intro: Sinapis pekinensis, commonly known as Chinese mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright stems and alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, characteristic of the mustard family. The plant produces spherical, hairy pods that contain several seeds, which are used in traditional Chinese medicine and as a spice.
